intro: Bulbostylis glabra, commonly known as the smooth bulbostylis, is a small, herbaceous plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in dense spikes. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its delicate structure and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
